Pre-Game Insights: Both teams have two points each from their two games and are sandwiched between leaders South Africa and bottom two sides Nepal and Sri Lanka.
Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto believes the side that tackles the conditions better will come out on top.
Bangladesh fans will continue supporting them in the West Indies, as they have done in the US leg of their matches.
The Netherlands are aware of the importance of the clash and their bowler Logan van Beek said the team has had'very nice' preparations ahead of it.
The Arnos Vale Stadium has not hosted an international cricket match in 10 years, and the pitch has produced an even contest between bat and ball, with spinners finding plenty of success.
